content:
With 20-30 hours of Netflix usage in 3 months, that's a decent amount of binge-watching! Finishing "The Umbrella Academy" and watching 5 episodes of "Stranger Things" season 4 is a great start.

To put that into perspective, according to Netflix's own statistics, the average user spends around 1 hour and 45 minutes per day watching content on the platform. Based on that, in 3 months, you'd have spent around 135 hours (1.75 hours/day × 90 days). So, your estimate of 20-30 hours is actually quite conservative!

Now, let's get back to finding your next great show. Considering your interest in "Stranger Things" and "The Umbrella Academy", I think you'll enjoy "Locke & Key" and "The Haunting of Hill House". Both shows have a similar blend of mystery, suspense, and supernatural elements that made those two shows so compelling.

If you want to explore more options, I can definitely provide some personalized recommendations based on your viewing history and preferences. Just let me know what you're in the mood for (e.g., more sci-fi, horror, comedy, etc.), and I'll suggest some shows that might interest you!
